domains.description: Comprehensive management of customer identity, demographics, preferences, and relationship data across all customer segments (B2C, B2B, B2B2x)

attributes.definition: Core customer identification, authentication, and authorization including unique customer IDs, digital identity, and multi-factor authentication
Customer personal and business information including name, address, contact details, date of birth, business registration, and tax information
Classification of customers by type (consumer, business, enterprise), value tier, lifecycle stage, and behavioral patterns
Customer preferences for communication channels, language, marketing opt-ins, service delivery preferences, and privacy settings
Management of customer relationships including family plans, business hierarchies, parent-child relationships, and account associations

domains.description: Management of customer accounts, billing relationships, service subscriptions, and account lifecycle from creation to closure

attributes.definition: End-to-end account setup process including identity verification, credit checks, service qualification, and initial provisioning
Account lifecycle states including active, suspended, pending, closed, and status transition workflows with business rules
Billing account associations, payment methods, billing cycles, invoice delivery preferences, and financial account management
Active service subscriptions, plan changes, add-ons, promotional offers, and subscription lifecycle management
Account termination processes, retention campaigns, win-back strategies, and data archival procedures

domains.description: Management of customer contact information, communication preferences, interaction history, and contact point lifecycle

attributes.definition: Multiple contact points including phone numbers, email addresses, physical addresses, social media handles, and communication channels
Verification and validation of contact information, opt-in/opt-out management, and contact point status tracking
Preferred communication channels, frequency preferences, time zone considerations, and language preferences
Complete history of customer interactions across all channels including calls, chats, emails, and in-person visits
Management of contact point creation, updates, verification, and deactivation with audit trails

domains.description: Comprehensive, real-time view of customer across all touchpoints, services, and interactions providing complete customer context

attributes.definition: Single source of truth for customer information aggregating data from all systems and touchpoints
Real-time synchronization of customer data across CRM, billing, service, and operational systems
Complete view of all customer services, subscriptions, usage patterns, and service dependencies
Contextual information for customer interactions including recent activities, preferences, and service status
AI-driven insights for customer behavior, churn prediction, next-best actions, and personalized recommendations

domains.description: Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, compliance, and governance across all customer and account data

attributes.definition: Automated validation, deduplication, and cleansing of customer data to ensure accuracy and consistency
GDPR, CCPA, and other privacy regulation compliance including consent management and data retention policies
Tracking data sources, transformations, and usage across systems for compliance and audit purposes
Centralized management of customer master data with governance policies and data stewardship
Continuous monitoring of data quality metrics, alerts for data issues, and automated quality improvement

market_research.competitive_analysis: Analysis of 3 major vendors with average scores ranging from 0 to 0

recommendations.next_steps: Continue research on Account & Contact Management with focus on 5 domains and 40 attributes
